Reviews.Content: Don't Stay Here! My husband and I stayed in the ensuite room with our own private bath. If you decide to use the shower you will have a lake that fills up the entire bathroom floor. I was unable to sleep the entire night due to the thin walls and being able to hear every conversation that went on in the rooms next to us. This is after the front desk clerk told me that the room was very quite. The room temperature is controlled by the front desk which basically means that we froze all night even though we asked them to turn the heat on twice. The only plus was the location. Not worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Patra8

Reviews.Content: Hepatitis Health Hazard ******AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ANY COST!*********We stayed (my partner and I) at the Ester hotel for 3 nights.During this time, we had hundreds of BITES on our body. Upon investigation, we saw that the room and the mattresses, and walls were INFESTED with BED BUGS. Upon medical advice, we had to INCINERATE our luggage, which was very EXPENSIVE. Also, bed bugs may carry HEPATITIS C, which is obviously a serious health hazard. Upon complaint, the hotel didn't bother contacting us back. ******AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ANY COST!*********
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWHIZ99

Reviews.Content: An experience What can you say about the Ester? A budget hotel set about 100 yards away from the central station and within easy walking distance to thecities main attractions.The hotel is on the second floor of a mid terrace building. The lobbyis absolutely tiny and had a very distinct smell of mould and cigarette smoke (no public place smoking ban in Italy!).The room was tiny, the one we were in overlooked the main street and had a tiny balcony, which didn't look the safest. A tiny sink in one corner of the room and a shared toilet/shower which was one of the worst showers I've ever used.We were there for one night, on our way back to the UK from San Marino, so we only booked it to get us closer to Pisa airport.Overall a hotel that is suitable for travellers on a budget, certainly not one I'd take my wife
Reviews.Author: ell33

Reviews.Content: nice but not very clean       not very clean
Reviews.Author: JulieRomania

Reviews.Content: Couldn't be more perfect! We booked our (my girlfriend, our best friend, and I) stay on hostels.com and were VERY happy with our choice! It was, hands down, the best place to stay for travelers under 30! The staff was more than nice and very young and fun. They told us all the awesome places to go and things to see while we were there. Bathrooms are shared. We stayed in the room closest to the front desk, so the shower room was right outside of our door! There are sinks, vanities and TV's in the rooms, which we loved! There was also a balcony overlooking the city which was breathtaking and exciting! The hotel was close to a lot of food and no more than a 1 min walk from the train station!
Reviews.Author: BentleyTravelFreak

Reviews.Content: A Budget Hotel Well, you get what you pay for.....We knew this wasn't a multiple star hotel when we booked it. Our son had stayed here a couple of times recently and recommended it. It has a great location - very near the train station and convenient to all the Florence attractions.The room is Econo Lodge quality, but that's the price range we wanted to spend. We didn't stay all that long in the room, and as Tom Bodette says, all the rooms look the same when you're sleeping.Massimo and his staff were very accomodating and helpful. No breakfast included, but plenty of nearby places to go. There's even a supermarket outside the train station where we bought yogurt and pastries for breakfast.If you're on a budget, this is the place to stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The WORST hotel EVER!! We arrived only to be told we weren't staying in the main building but some other room 3 streets away. When we went into our room it was dark so we turned on the bare bulb swinging out of the ceiling. It took another while to get to our balcony as the linoleum floor was so sticky we could barely get our feet off it. We then discovered there was a sink in the room which we initially thought was a plus as the main bathroom was a) communal and b) down at the end of the hall. We should have realised all was not well when we spotted the half coke bottle and the plunger beside the sink. We turned on the taps to discover it was completely blocked and unusable.The bed was lumpy and conjured images of a seedy motel.And finally, even though we did have a balcony, it was overlooking about 10 enormous bins that stank.Needless to say we got out of there as fast as we could the next morning.STAY AWAY!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
